tit.e: Senmyo Calendar (a variation of the lunar calendar that was created in ancient China)

sen.j: 宣明暦（せんみょうれき）とは中国暦の一つである。
sen.e: Senmyo Calendar is one of the Chinese calendars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Senmyo Calendar is one of the Chinese calendars.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: かつて中国・日本などで使われていた太陰太陽暦の暦法である。
sen.e: It is a lunar-solar calendar, and used to be used in China and Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a lunar-solar calendar, and used to be used in China and Japan.

sen.j: 正式には長慶宣明暦（ちょうけいせんみょうれき）と言う。
sen.e: It is officially called Chokei Senmyo Calendar.
It is officially called the Chokei Senmyo Calendar.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is officially called the Chokei Senmyo Calendar.

sen.j: 和暦の日付は、旧暦表示。
sen.e: The old Japanese calendar is based on the old lunar calendar.
The old Japanese calendar is based on the old lunar calendar.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Japanese calendar is based on the old lunar calendar.

sen.j: 西暦の日付は、1582年10月4日まではユリウス暦表示。1582年10月15日以降はグレゴリオ暦表示。
sen.e: The Christian Era was based on the Julian calendar until October 4, 1582, and it has been based on the Gregorian calendar since October 15, 1582.
The Christian Era was based on the Julian calendar until October 4, 1582, and it has been based on the Gregorian calendar since October 15, 1582.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 唐の長慶2年（822年）から景福 (唐)元年（892年）までの71年間使用された。
sen.e: The calendar was used for 71 years from 822 to 892 in Tang China.
The calendar was used for 71 years from 822 to 892 in Tang China.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The calendar was used for 71 years from 822 to 892 in Tang China.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貞観 (日本)4年1月1日 (旧暦)（862年2月3日）に大衍暦・五紀暦から改暦され、貞享元年12月30日 (旧暦)（1685年2月3日）まで、823年間使用された。
sen.e: Senmyo Calendar replaced Taien reki (Taien Calendar) and Goki reki (Wuji calendar, a luni-solar calendar developed in the Tang by Guo Xianzhi and used in China during 762 - 821)) on February 3, 862, and was used for 823 years until February 3, 1685.
sen.cmt: 用語集では、「大衍暦」は、 Taien reki と、「五紀暦」は、Gokirekiとなっていますが、rekiの扱いを揃えた方が良いと思われましたので、GokirekiをGoki rekiとしました。
sen.e: Senmyo Calendar replaced the Taien reki (Taien Calendar) and the Goki reki (Wuji calendar, a luni-solar calendar developed in the Tang by Guo Xianzhi and used in China during 762 - 821)) on February 3, 862, and was used for 823 years until February 3, 1685.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Senmyo Calendar replaced the Taien reki (Taien Calendar) and the Goki reki (Wuji calendar) on February 3, 862, and was used for 823 years until February 3, 1685.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 貞享2年1月1日（1685年2月4日）、貞享暦に改暦される
sen.e: It was replaced by Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) on February 4, 1685.
It was replaced by the Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) on February 4, 1685.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Senmyo Calendar was replaced by the Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) on February 4, 1685.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 唐の徐昴が編纂したもので、当時としては優れた暦法であった。
sen.e: It was compiled by Joko in Tang China based on a superior method of making calendars at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was compiled by Joko in Tang China based on a superior method of making calendars at that time.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: The Senmyo Calendar, compiled by Joko in Tang China, was a superior calendar at that time.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 特に日食や月食の予報に進歩が見られた。
sen.e: The method was especially better in forecasting solar eclipses and lunar eclipses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The method was especially better at forecasting solar and lunar eclipses.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The calendar was particularly better at forecasting solar and lunar eclipses.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天安 (日本)3年（859年）に渤海使がもたらした。
sen.e: Bokkaishi introduced Senmyo Calendar in 859.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Bokkaishi introduced the Senmyo Calendar in 859.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Bokkaishi introduced the Senmyo Calendar in 859.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それまでの大衍暦・五紀暦に代わり用いられる。
sen.e: It replaced Taien reki and Goki reki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It replaced the Taien reki and the Goki reki.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It replaced the Taien reki and the Goki reki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 暦博士大春日真野麻呂の強い推挙によるものとされている。
sen.e: It is said that the calendar was strongly recommended by OKASUGA no Manomaro, who was reki hakase (master of reki (calendar)).
It is said that the calendar was strongly recommended by OKASUGA no Manomaro, who was a reki hakase (master of reki - calendar).
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: It is said that the calendar was strongly recommended by OKASUGA no Manomaro, who was a reki hakase (master of reki - calendar).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後、朝廷の衰退や暦学の停滞などにより改暦が行われなかった。
sen.e: After that, the calendar was not changed because of the weakened imperial court and the sluggish study of the calendar.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, the calendar was not changed because of the weakened imperial court and the sluggish study of the calendar.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: After that, the calendar was not replaced by a new calendar because of the weakened imperial court and the sluggish study of the calendar.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 長期にわたり使用されたために誤差が蓄積することになる。
sen.e: Because the calendar was used for a long period of time, errors were accumulated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the calendar was used for a long period of time, errors accumulated.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Because the calendar was used for a long period of time, errors had been accumulated.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、暦の編纂は本来は朝廷が独占して行うものであり、暦の算出法に関する書物は陰陽寮以外には秘書とされていた。
sen.e: The calendar used to be compiled solely by the imperial court, and books concerning calendar calculation methods were secret except Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The calendar used to be compiled solely by the imperial court, and books concerning calendar calculating methods were secret except for the Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The calendar used to be compiled solely by the imperial court, and books concerning calendar calculations were secret except for the Onmyoryo (Bureau of Divination).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、宣明暦があまりにも長く使用されていたために、次第に民間に流布するようになり、さらには出版されるようになった。
sen.e: However, because Senmyo Calendar was used for so many years, the calendar started to be distributed among the general public, and also started to be published.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because the Senmyo Calendar was used for so many years, the calendar began to be distributed amongst the general public, and also published.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, because the Senmyo Calendar was used for quite a long period, the calendar began to be distributed among the general public, and also published.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: さらに、鎌倉時代以降は朝廷の力が弱まり、京で作られた暦が地方へ伝達しにくくなったことから、各地で独自に宣明暦の暦法によった暦（民間暦）が作られるようになった。
sen.e: In addition, because the imperial court started to lose power after the Kamakura period, and it became difficult to distribute calendars produced in Kyoto to regional areas, calendars (private calendars) based on the rekiho (a method of making calendars) of Senmyo Calendar started to be produced independently in various parts of the country.

In addition, because the imperial court started to lose power after the Kamakura period, and it became difficult to distribute calendars produced in Kyoto to regional areas, calendars (private calendars) based on the rekiho (a method of making calendars) of the Senmyo Calendar started to be produced independently in various parts of the country.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In addition, because the imperial court started to lose power after the Kamakura period, and it became difficult to distribute calendars produced in Kyoto to regional areas, calendars (private calendars) based on a method of making calendars of the Senmyo Calendar began to be produced independently in various parts of the country.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが、戦国時代 (日本)に朝廷において暦道を担当していた勘解由小路家が断絶した影響などで京における暦の編纂に混乱が生じた。
sen.e: However, because a family line of the Kadenokoji family, which was in charge of rekido in the imperial court in the Sengoku period (the period of warring states) ended, the compilation of the calendar in Kyoto became disorganized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because a family line of the Kadenokoji family, in charge of rekido in the imperial court during the Sengoku period (the period of warring states) ended, the compilation of the calendar in Kyoto became disorganized.

sen.e: However, because the Kadenokoji family, which was in charge of calendar making in the imperial court during the Sengoku period (the period of warring states), was cut off, the compilation of the calendar in Kyoto became disorganized.

sen.j: 京と地方の民間暦との間で置閏法などに違いが生じるなどの混乱が発生した。
sen.e: As a result, the calendar compiled in Kyoto and private calendars had different Chijun-ho (a calendar technique of setting leap month and leap day), and confusion arose.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result, the calendar compiled in Kyoto and private calendars had different Chijun-ho (a calendar technique for setting the leap month and leap day), and confusion arose.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: As a result, a confusion occurred between the calendar compiled in Kyoto and private calendars such that the calendars used different Chijun-ho (a calendar technique for setting the leap month and leap day).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 例えば、天正11年（1583年）1月に京暦で行われる予定の閏月が、民間の三島暦を採用していた後北条氏・上杉氏・里見氏などの領内では前年の天正10年12月に閏月が行われた。
sen.e: For instance, a leap month scheduled for January 1583 according to Kyo-goyomi (a calendar made by Onyoryo (Bureau of Divination) in Kyoto) occurred in December 1582 in the estates of the Gohojo clan, the Uesugi clan and the Satomi clan where Mishima-goyomi (a calendar made by the Kawai family and distributed from Mishima-taisha Shrine) was adopted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For instance, a leap month scheduled for January 1583 according to Kyo-goyomi (a calendar made by Onyoryo - Bureau of Divination - in Kyoto) occurred in December 1582 at the estates of the Gohojo, the Uesugi, and Satomi clans where Mishima-goyomi (a calendar made by the Kawai family and distributed from the Mishima-taisha Shrine) was adopted.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: For instance, a leap month scheduled for January 1583 according to Kyo-goyomi (a calendar made by Onyoryo - Bureau of Divination - in Kyoto) occurred in December 1582 in the estates of the Gohojo, the Uesugi, and Satomi clans where a private calendar Mishima-goyomi (a calendar made by the Kawai family and distributed from the Mishima-taisha Shrine) was adopted.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 特に信濃国では同じ国内であるにも関わらず、真田氏・蘆田氏は三島暦、諏訪氏・小笠原氏は京暦に従って閏月を実施するなどの混乱が生じた。
sen.e: In particular in Shinano Province where the Sanada clan and the Ashita clan adopted Mishima-goyomi (a calendar made by the Kawai family and distributed from Mishima-taisha Shrine), and the Suwa clan and the Ogasawara clan adopted Kyo-goyomi (a calendar made by Onyoryo (Bureau of Divination) in Kyoto), confusion occurred because a leap month occurred differently in the same province.

sen.j: 更に江戸時代初期には、二十四節気や朔などが実際よりも2日早く記載されるようになっていた（もっとも、9世紀に作成された暦が800年で2日間しかずれなかったと見ることも可能である）。
sen.e: In addition, 24 divisions of the old calendar and the first day of the month started to be indicated two days earlier than actual dates in the early part of the Edo period (it can also be said that the calendar compiled in the ninth century had only a margin of error of two days).

In addition, 24 divisions of the old calendar and the first day of the month started to be indicated two days earlier than actual dates in the early part of the Edo period (it can also be said that the calendar compiled in the ninth century had only a margin of error of two days).

sen.j: このために渋川春海によって貞享暦が編纂され改暦が行われる。
sen.e: Because of this, Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) was compiled by Harumi SHIBUKAWA as a new calendar.
Because of this, the Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) was compiled by Harumi SHIBUKAWA as a new calendar.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Because of this, the Jokyo reki (Jokyo calendar) was compiled by Harumi SHIBUKAWA as a new calendar to replace the Senmyo Calendar.
